website_summaries.verdict: These low-maintenance, 80% merino wool socks will keep your feet warm on any winter hike.
pros: Alvada’s socks include a cushioned footbed for maximum comfort
No need to worry about having to stop and pull your socks up
these rest at ankle height, making them perfect for hiking boots
To clean, just put them in the wash on cold
cons: Runs large — not for small feet

customer_reviews.title: Check size chart before ordering--description is wrong
customer_reviews.text: These socks are thick, and very warm; they have saved my toes this winter. The problem is, I ordered by the description which says M-L is for women shoe size 9.5-12. That's wrong; it's for MEN shoe size 9.5-12, and women size 11-13. The picture shows my regular sock for size 10 shoe, and these socks size M-L.
customer_reviews.author: glenk

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks
customer_reviews.text: Hubby ordered these socks. He chose them. He ordered them. He wanted them for hunting.He loves them. He had read they are great for people who have sweaty feet. They wick away the moisture. After wearing all day to work , when he came home his feet were dry. Socks came on time
customer_reviews.author: Thompsons

customer_reviews.title: I suffer from Small Fiber Neuropathy, and these socks are incredibly comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Because I suffer from Small Fiber Neuropathy and Centralized Pain Syndrome, it's very difficult to find socks that are comfortable. Most socks irritate and increase the pain in my feet. These socks are incredible. They feel like you are slipping your feet into a cloud. I wear a size 10.5-11 depending on the shoe, and the medium--large size fits good. They are not constrictive like some socks can be, which is important when you suffer from Small Fiber Neuropathy. I will definitely purchase more of these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Todd

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks were really comfortable during a 20 mile backpacking trip on the Ozark trail. They kept my feet nice and dry the whole time, even though I was sweating pretty hard. They seem to be good quality. I've only had them for a couple of weeks, so only time will tell on their longevity/ durability. The company certainly seems to stand behind their product, which I definitely appreciate. Another thing to note is that these socks are thicker than the REI-branded pair that I bought from REI, which cost $15 for a single pair. I would definitely recommend these over the REI ones.
customer_reviews.author: ashley osorio

customer_reviews.title: Best Socks EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a total merino wool junkie. Living way up north we get some very cold weather and I’ve never see anything like these merino wool socks. We all know once your feet get cold then the rest of you gets cold. Well these socks keep your feet warm, dry and are these are so breathable. Best socks I have ever owned. I wash them in cold water in the washing machine and they come out perfect. Very durable warm socks. Not at all itchy. Merino wool is very soft with lots of stretch yet the socks stay put. I highly recommend these. They are a great value and a very well made item.
customer_reviews.author: Snowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Four years and counting!
customer_reviews.text: I've slowly thrown out all my other winter/fall socks and replaced them with these every season. There's no better sock for comfort and winter ruggedness! A lot of smart wool socks will either shrink with time or be uncomfortable after a few washes because they're not meant to stretch. Not these. They're crazy soft and stretchy. I use them of course for hiking and snowboarding but also in the fall for just walking around Boston. You can't go wrong with these socks! They're also very durable as the first pairs are still as good as the new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Sock
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable socks for Winter. I purchased 9 brands of socks and these were my 2nd favorite....which is really good as my favorite winter sock cost $8.65 made by Danish Endurance ASIN# B07Z3VDXMM. Other socks tested included: Fun Toes ASIN# B07QMX8JBX Dickies ASIN# B07QTVKNNQ Mirmaru ASIN# B0793KDNMC Under Armour ASIN# B073D6D7VY I then had 4 others do a sock test with me and the average rating results pus Alvada at the top! Alvada: 4.5 Fun Toes: 4.1 Danish: 4.1 Under Armour 3.8 Mirmaru: 3.3 Dickies: 3.3
customer_reviews.author: Phil Sigler

customer_reviews.title: These do not hold up
customer_reviews.text: My husband hates slippers but likes cozy socks. He only wore these in the house on tile, carpet and polished hardwood. Each pair wore the same. Huge holes
customer_reviews.author: J P

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality for Half The Price!
customer_reviews.text: We hike in the Sierra Nevadas every year and always buy the high-end wool socks for our hiking boots. I forgot my high-end ones and ordered these because they would arrive quickly. They are better than my expensive hiking socks and they are way softer! I ended up ordering pairs for our entire family and they love them. They're held up under extreme hiking conditions and they wash clean and don't wear or tear, at least not yet. We've been hiking in them for 2 months now and they still look brand new. No pilling after washing and no shrinking either. LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Nice thick well made warm and durable
customer_reviews.text: I do not dislike anything about these. I do like the soft comfortable feel, and I like the way they keep my feet warm in cold weather. I have not had these long enough to really tell you the longevity but I have worn these through 7 washings so far. On washing these, I turn them inside out and wash and dry by hand. Machine washing can cause merino wool to gall, or that is form little balls hanging by a thread on the outside. By washing and drying in by hand, which is easy, they are not tumbled in a machine to cause that galling. They still look brand new. This review is ONLY for the Alvado brand socks.
customer_reviews.author: J W

customer_reviews.title: These blow anus
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible. First day wearing them and within 10 minutes of wearing them I was already struggling with keeping them up. I have never wrote a review for any thing Ive purchased on amazon but im at work and my toes are freezing balls and im pissed. Pretty sure they are not wool and they are thick for no reason.
customer_reviews.author: Sara W.

customer_reviews.title: Elastic gives out faster than other socks
customer_reviews.text: In the past I've purchased People Socks, which are fantastic. I tried these because they were cheaper and had a higher percentage of wool. They are noticeably thicker and more comfortable out of the box, so I was initially very happy. However, I noticed right away that these socks tend to develop a bad smell, and after two months, they no longer stay up. I was able to wear People Socks until the heels wore out, which took over two years, and I never encountered either of these problems.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Harder

customer_reviews.title: Great quality heavyweight sock
customer_reviews.text: I consider this a heavyweight sock because it will change the way your boots fit. If you need really thick socks to take up some space in your large boot, these socks are money. If you already have perfect fitting boots, then these are may cram up your feet a bit, and that's what happened for me. But I think they are otherwise really comfortable, great quality, and the material blend is very nice. If I had the need for heavyweight socks, I would wholly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Your wife may try to steal them
customer_reviews.text: We live in the south, but our boat is up north and when we had to move her late in the season the missus and I each bought some cold weather gear. She got herself some wool socks from a well known outdoor retailer, paying twice this price. On the web site it gave no indication of wool content. Given the reputation of the store (and the price) she assumed they would be good quality. When hers arrived they were only 21% wool. (These are 80% wool and very warm.) She was annoyed. And, she soon had cold feet and started wearing these. Good thing it was a 3-pack.
customer_reviews.author: CM6464

customer_reviews.title: Warm winter socks- Just do not wash them!
customer_reviews.text: These socks are wonderful. They kept my feet warm in the cold snow and they are very comfortable and soft. My son, who is 12 really loves wearing them around the house. They definitely keep the moisture away from your feet so no stinky boy's feet! I would recommend washing them by hand. We put a pair in the wash and it seem to rub some of the material away. They are definitely soft, warm and worth the money if you want good snow socks that will keep your feet warm in the cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: CAPV

customer_reviews.title: GREAT socks to keep your feet dry!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these recently for a trip to Iceland. They kept my feet both warm and dry! TMI - my feet get very sweaty in winter. Most of my socks, even Smartwool and LL Bean, get wet after wearing all day. I wore these all over walking in Iceland and they were still dry at the end of the day. They are slightly cushioned. I wore a cushion in my shoes, too, but it was comfortable for walking all day. I would recommend turning them inside out when washing them in cold water. I washed one early and it pilled a little. Otherwise, seems like a great sock!!! I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy M.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Socks!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had these long enough to really comment on the longevity and durability, but I will comment on other qualities and my experience. These socks are wonderful. I've bought a set for both my boys, mom and dad. My Dad has had poor circulation for years, but he said for the first time in years his feet didn't feel cold when wearing them. I also have a hard time keeping my feet warm during the winter, but these keep my feel comfortable and warm. I really like them and I would recommended them highly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These Alvada Merino wool hiking socks are the best socks I've EVER had
customer_reviews.text: These Alvada Merino wool hiking socks are the best socks I've EVER had! All the good reviews are right! They are very warm, and super comfortable. Inside is super soft, like fleece. They fit well. I don't normally do product reviews, but this product is so good, they deserve a good review. I'll be buying more for sure, even though the price went up by $2, it's still a bargain. I've paid a LOT more than this for one pair of socks. One thing I did find is that the threads seems to snag easily, that's the ONLY negative I can think of. I sleep in them and wear them around the house too. GREAT product!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence D Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Soft, comfortable, and WARM
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband. He takes public transportation, so he gets really cold. When he put them on, he couldn't stop talking about how soft, comfortable, and warm they were. He wore them around the house for a little and kept getting weirded out that he could barely tell the difference between our carpets and our linoleum. It was compared to a very plush carpet multiple times, and he said that they were very warm. Will likely buy a few more pairs for him when we have the money, as well as some for me.
customer_reviews.author: skyler nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great sock, but worn out in less than two months.
customer_reviews.text: This is a late review, but I came across my pile of holy socks this morning. At first I loved these socks, comfy, good fit. I ordered a set for a Christmas gift for my brother. But after less than two months, huge holes at the big toe in five out of six socks. I don’t know if I’m hard on socks, but my normal Cotten blend don’t have this problem, and my wallyworld pairs of wool socks I seem to get at least 2-3 years out of.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Review Probably Not Needed
customer_reviews.text: Oh, I can’t tell you how fab these are. My feet are so cold some days that I have to wear my Cathcart’s which are seriously thick and used in my Ugg Adirondack boots (snow/rain/COLD). I have Converse CT All Star High Top, which are great winter shoes, weather proof, but not warm as I thought. I bought them size larger to wear with heavy socks or Ugg insoles. These socks do the trick. These are thick, but nothing like Cathcarts + a crew sock. So I can still scrunch down on my skinny pants and look so cute with hi-top Converse. These are even thermal up leg also. Can’t say enough, I just wish more colors.
customer_reviews.author: Judi Haase

customer_reviews.title: price compare to Wigam
customer_reviews.text: I've wore Wigman socks of the same type for years and still I can swear by them they last for years, comfort and keep your feet dry summer and winter. However for the price on amazon you get 1 pair and Alavda you get 3 pairs. So I decided to try them. Merino wool 80% pretty much exact same features, same fit and wear, remove sweat, same comfort. I can't comment on longevity yet but expect them to last the same as Wigam. I will buy again and would recommend them. Price is the only difference that causes me to choose Alavada.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw?
customer_reviews.text: Love these socks, very thick, very comfotable. But, after just a few washings, they are "dissolving" at the heal. Three out of six have heals that are complete holes. I'm not hard on socks. No running, almost no workout at all. Never saw anything like this. Bet I'm not the only one.
customer_reviews.author: lonestar

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, incredible socks!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a sock connoisseur. I own dozens if not hundreds of them. Why? Because I hate cold feet. I’ve purchased them from all over the place including several different types from Amazon. These socks are by far my favorite. Sure, they start a little bit on the extra roomy side but after they’ve been washed a couple of times and put in the dryer they will shrink just a bit and fit perfectly. At least they do for me. You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: DanR

customer_reviews.title: for anyone who lives in New York....
customer_reviews.text: these socks are a-freaking-mazing!!! I live in NY and right now it's some days freezing and some days below freezing. I have thin work shoes so normally my feet would be numb by the time I get home, but these socks....omg let me tell you...... they kept my feet warm all day. Even my wife who is very picky about everything loves them. I would seriously SERIOUSLY recommend these socks..... SERIOUSLY
customer_reviews.author: maria jose

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife, she works in a manufacturing building, the floor is concrete, so in the winter it is really cold. I've been buying socks from the warming store at around $15-$20 per sock. I decided to just poke around on Amazon for some because well I buy like EVERYTHING we need from here (been a customer since 1999). She LOVES these socks more than the warming store ones. I thought being that these are meant for hiking they'd work okay for her and the fact that they are like 1/2 price as the other socks is great too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Delano

customer_reviews.title: Love these socks!
customer_reviews.text: I have developed peripheral neuropathy which makes my feet feel very uncomfortable all the time. These socks are so luxurious they are like medicine for my feet. They do shrink down a little bit from the dryer so don't recommend drying them with heat. Even with the slight shrinking they still go on very easily and feel great. I go without shoes in the house and the socks show no damaging wear yet. Very satisfied. Recently ordered 3 more pair just to make sure I have plenty of them.
customer_reviews.author: Old Gare

customer_reviews.title: Amazing wool socks
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this is the best socks I have ever worn. I been looking for a good sock to keep my feet dry year around in full leather steal toe work boots. I tried dryfit type socks and mean I have tried everything but never gave a thought to wool socks thinking they would be too hot. Nope not the case. These are soft cool and natural wicking. I have ordered more. Amazing! Only if someone told me about wool socks sooner...
customer_reviews.author: mc

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and warm socks - no shrinkage
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for hiking up in Seattle, where it was cold when I bought these. They did the job beautifully and I found myself putting these on around the house just because of how comfortable they were. The last potential issue I was concerned about was shrinkage, but I've washed them three times since in a traditional washer dryer and haven't had any issues. Will probably buy more after summer
customer_reviews.author: Vinson Z

customer_reviews.title: No sweaty tootsies so your feet stay comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Really like these socks! Usually my feet will perspire in boots then my feet get cold. I’m so happy I purchased these. Not too thick so that my books are tight, and no irritating seems that rub my feet, which is especially great when you’re diabetic. I definitely recommend these socks!
customer_reviews.author: got2laf40

customer_reviews.title: My go to sock
customer_reviews.text: Had some of these given to me for Christmas of 2018. I LOVE the way this wool stays in that 'new sock' feel for a long time. It took 2 years of solid work wear to finally bring them down at the pressure points where I walk (for most folks this would be the heel, I wear out the front area first). I'm now on my second set, here's hoping they keep up the lovely quality and durability!
customer_reviews.author: WritinLady

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Winters are usually pretty mild here on the Gulf Coast, but during a recent cold snap, my husband realized that his new perforated running shoes, which had been comfortably breathable in warm weather, were unpleasantly airish in the cold. His old wool socks were motheaten and worn, so he looked for a replacement, and I bought him these as a belated birthday gift. This morning he wore them out in a chilly rain and proclaimed them more than satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne S. Barnhill

customer_reviews.title: My favorite socks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a trip to Red River Gorge in February and fell in love with them. They are almost like slippers. They fit good in my bulky hiking boots, and they were great in and out on the deck of our cabin when it was 30 degrees outside and my feet stayed warm. I am wondering if the people saying that they get holes in them are putting them in the dryer. I definitely wouldn’t do that. I line dry them.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany R

customer_reviews.title: Love these socks!
customer_reviews.text: 1. These socks fit as expectedwhen I went up to Lake Tahoe in the snow and I also let my son use the socks when he went hiking in the Marin headlands in the Bay Area and he really liked them so I highly recommend these socks. 1. I really like how they were able to keep our feet warm but we’re also thin enough to fit our snow and hiking boots without feeling uncomfortably thick.
customer_reviews.author: april crawford

customer_reviews.title: OMG don't look at these socks!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy these because they are too expensive, you won't like em. I saw them advertised on CNN, they are fake cotton, acrylic socks, these are mostly soft wool,& they so warm in bitter cold weather, also they are very soft and fit like a glove, these are not a manly sock, also they are not the itchy type of socks. I will need to buy them all to prevent mistakes when yall buy them.
customer_reviews.author: AReview4U

customer_reviews.title: Cozy toes
customer_reviews.text: Living up north, you must have the proper attire to stay warm. So we heard about getting wools socks, because it keeps your toes warm and cozy. These socks are great, I purchased it for my husband, because after putting double sometimes even 3 pair of regular socks together in effort to stay warm, it would not work and his feet would sweat. These socks and this brand is by far the best, worth every penny, they fit comfortable, not too tight and don’t make your feet sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie H

customer_reviews.title: SHORT TERM USE, they're good and then they're done
customer_reviews.text: I've had these less than four months and they are worn out. I don't wear them daily and they aren't subjected to hard use. They're fat socks so are tight in everything but my outdoor boots and they don't wear well, I won't be buying them again because they aren't a cost effective choice for me.. That being said, they're warm to wear in any slightly too big footwear you may have and they'll keep your feet snug.
customer_reviews.author: Da Lowrider

customer_reviews.title: Stay warm when Dog walking
customer_reviews.text: These socks help on this cold mornings and evenings when I walk my dog. ❤️They hold up the heat and never let my toes go cold like normal socks would. My feet naturally sweat, too, and these hold up pretty well when it comes to moisture wicking. My recommendation for long lasting is to wash them with mild detergent in cold water and then hang dry. I really love these socks and usually wear them just for my dog walks or when it's super cold out/snowing.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Agee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, very Warm Socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks are so warm and cozy. I just love them and am buying more for Christmas stocking stuffers. I wear these socks instead of slippers and they keep me very warm even on the cold basement floor when doing laundry or if I have to run to the garage for something. I wash them in cold water and hang to dry and have no problem with shrinkage at all. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle S.

customer_reviews.title: NOT SEAMLESS INSIDE
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with this purchase. There is a small bundle of thread where the toe seam ends. It hits right between my baby toe and my shoe. It is quite uncomfortable. I have had other socks that were seamless inside and there was not nub where the seam ended. I can't cut it off, or the seam will unravel. I guess you wouldn't think such a small thing could create such discomfort, but for me it does. Will not being buying anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Acctthis

customer_reviews.title: Good winter socks
customer_reviews.text: Although these are being marketed as hiking socks they are not waterproof.. still good socks and anyone who works outdoors would be wise to make the investment in a few pairs of these especially for winter... They are comparable to heavy cotton socks in fit and comfort when Dry but it is in wet and cold weather that your investment will pay off.. your feet will still be wet and cold but far less so.. like 75% less.
customer_reviews.author: mountaineer

customer_reviews.title: Great first pair
customer_reviews.text: Someone told me to wear a pair of wool socks in the middle of Tennessee summer weather. I thought they were a bit nuts, still did since they were more of a mentor. I am an arborist by trade, I cut trees and drag them off. I wear a pair of 6" boots. They are very cushioney however not hot and swampy like cotton socks did. I am not that much of a sweaty person--well until I worked 8 hours a day outside. They are bit warmer but they are dry at the end of either a rainy or hot dry day.
customer_reviews.author: John Sounthonevichith

customer_reviews.title: GREAT socks
customer_reviews.text: I like these socks so much I ordered some for my wife and son. These socks are thick and comfortable and cushioned. I washed them in warm water and even dried them on high and they didn't shrink. 1 small detail that I really like is on the inside top of the sock is the size in blue thread. I like that because I will always be able to tell my socks from theirs. Seriously, these are GREAT socks!
customer_reviews.author: Beeswax

customer_reviews.title: 6 star's!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to rewrite my review after a winter in Montana working outside in -40. I wore these all winter in regular uninsulated boots in subzero temps. Sometimes spending hours standing and walking in the snow cleaning out RR switches. My feet stayed warm all winter and about to put them through another. Washed and dried fine. If I could give them 6 stars I would. Fitment wise I'd say they're medium thickness. I wear Timberland pro's with a composite toe and these fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Plan B

customer_reviews.title: My 77 year old father loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my father who is 77 years old for Christmas (he already opened them early ;o) He just sent me a text saying he LOVES these socks. Not quite sure what he loves about them he didn't get that specific but I thought I would leave this feedback anyways. I only purchased them based on all the rave reviews and now I can see why they are getting all the great reviews. If my aging father loves them they must be good ;o)
customer_reviews.author: JJbad

customer_reviews.title: Nice and soft but..
customer_reviews.text: Nice and soft, but already coming apart Update: not even a week later there's already a hole, wish they lasted longer
customer_reviews.author: Leilani

customer_reviews.title: Very warm in military tough situations
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for some field training exercises and they worked amazingly well. I was out on the mountains in below freezing temperatures, getting below zero and these suckers kept my feet warm all night marching through the mountains. I cannot recommend them enough. They fit male and female. Soft texture, excellent for military or civilian boots. Would highly recommend for anyone spending more than a few hours in the cold. As an added bonus, accidentally washed and dried them, the shrinkage was almost non-existent and did not impact the heat. So, excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite thick socks for winter.
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to dislike. These are pretty thick, comfy and do not itch. Winter has arrived and these are one of my go to socks to keep my feet warm in the cold. I have washed and warn these a lot since purchase and do not see any wear in these yet. They do not look stretched out and do not fall or go under the heel while walking, and I am a walker.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: After wearing these a few times now I'm loving them. They are thick so they make your shoes a little tight but they are very comfortable and keep your feet very dry! I have tiny feet and huge calves and the top doesn't bite into my skin either which is awesome. I haven't had them long so I'm hoping the quality stays firm and they last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Oloughlin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully soft and warm
customer_reviews.text: The moment you put them on you appreciate how soft and comfortable these socks are. Yesterday I was working in the yard in 10 degree weather and didn't realize I still had my sneakers on! They're so warm. They're certainly not cheap but boy are they worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Somersetman

customer_reviews.title: Where have these been all my life?!
customer_reviews.text: 8 years in the Infantry, 9 years on a warehouse dock and another 4 years in the film and television industry on set... My dogs have spent A LOT of time in boots over the years and with that I have been searching for socks that could really help with moisture control. These socks are amazing!!! I can not vouch for warm weather performance but I have gone from 2 to 3 sock changes a day with the cotton socks I have normally worn, but with these my feet are bone dry when they come out od my boots after some grueling 17 hour days. I will never wear cotton socks again in boots since finding these. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Jada Akers

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted good socks to keep my feet warm during the cold New England winter, but I was fairly picky. I wanted them to be at least 70% wool, preferably merino because it's soft; I wanted them to be really thick; and I wanted them to be machine washable and dryable. These socks were the only ones that I found which fit the bill. I like them so much that I ordered another 3 pairs the following week. And when these wear out, I'll hope to be able to find the same ones again.
customer_reviews.author: Breizhusa

customer_reviews.title: Cushy soft comfort, low price per pair
customer_reviews.text: This is the best deal I could find for quality socks. I have been buying cheapo wallmart socks and the heels wear out immediately. These Merino wool socks are pure comfort. I wore them with my Sorel boots in the snow and my feet were very warm. I don't get some of the reviews,people complain about crazy things...these socks rock. the sizing was accurate, they definitely have a label/packaging, and they stay up just fine. Time will tell regarding the durability, but I'm optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: FrazierDave

customer_reviews.title: Morino wool is the perfect material for socks!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for really good morino wool socks and found them! I wear them year round. They don’t smell when your feet sweat and they go on and off easy. But I wear shoes with room for my feet. Tight shoes don’t adjust when your feet swell from walking or standing for long periods. Word of warning: Do not buy Crocs as they are addictive and these socks are a perfect companion! My cold weather crocs have a lining in them.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks - well worth the few extra dollars.
customer_reviews.text: I got six pairs of these originally. They have been through the wash now and still look, fit, and feel like new. The fit is good, they do not stretch inappropriately and great for cooler/cold weather. They have a good cushion to them. I just reordered another three pair to have enough on hand. I highly recommend these. I also like that they come in one color that goes with jeans rather than having mixed colors.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bogart

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks at a Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband after I almost murdered him because of his icy feet. We have experience with wool socks from visits to alaska and hiking in utah. He says he loves them and they're some of the best wool socks he's had. I liked them because they were a great price! I've paid as much for a single pair. When we opened them they were super soft and kept that softness after we washed them. They are really thick like wool socks should be. The only weird thing (and not worth tanking stars off) is that the logo is on the left side of the foot not the bottom. It looks a little strange.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Ring

customer_reviews.title: Warm, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are the best socks I've ever bought. They're warm enough to wear in cold northern weather and they're thicker at the toes where they're most needed. One caution: They're thick, so don't buy boots unless you try them on with these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as the best
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 6 pairs. Very happy, with socks. I would describe the weight as backpacker/expedition. I own some high cost ones, they seem slightly better, but nothing I can identify. For less than half the cost of my other ones, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jules Verne

customer_reviews.title: Very soft and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Soft, thick, and comfortable. They do not overheat my feet and they were great while hiking in January in the snow and ice. Other people that used them did complain that their feet got somewhat cold so probably not the warmest socks out there. They are of good quality for the price and I’m overall happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: So which and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these an another brand of thick winter socks. These were superior in every way. They may be more expensive than some of the other brands, but they are well worth the money. Even after a few washings they are still so comfortable and soft. Only problem may be if your shoes are already tight. these socks add some thickness to your shoes .
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: great socks
customer_reviews.text: They are super. Wore them skiing. They are not really thick, but of course they are not ultra thin- more of an in between. No, they won't keep your feet warm in a ski boot when it's zero degrees out- no sock will do that, but when it's 20's and above these socks are pretty nice. I like them and would buy them again
customer_reviews.author: donkey-boy

customer_reviews.title: Great socks for winter cycling
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with these socks. I've been using them to cycle in the winter and they are good without any additional layers down to about 40 degrees for a 6 to 8 mile ride. Really warm and comfortable and I can just throw them in the washer and dryer and they come out fine.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: SOCK HEAVEN!!!
customer_reviews.text: OH MY GOSH!!! I bought these socks when I started wearing 8" hiking/military spec boots for the added ankle support. SOCK HEAVEN. It is no exaggeration that these are The Most Comfortable Socks that I have ever worn in my 58 years upon this planet. I am on medication that causes me to sweat in copious amounts and with 8" boots I feared my feet would suffer. Nope. Nope. And Nope. Dry and cozy. I only purchased 2 sets of 3 but I will be getting more so I can last more than a week between washings.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie MUSTAFA

customer_reviews.title: Warm, comfortable, solid build
customer_reviews.text: I've only worn them a few times, but they don't seem to be tearing or anything (like the last socks I got from a different brand, which wore holes or ripped stitching in the first few days). I would easily recommend these. I haven't had a chance to get them really WET yet, but my feet have gotten hot / a little sweaty, but never felt very clammy or anything.
customer_reviews.author: rm_you

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend wearing these over 12 hours if your foot gets ...
customer_reviews.text: These socks are warm af yo..... I wear a size 7 shoe and they fit just right. I tested them as soon as I got them. My foot instantly started sweating. I wouldn't recommend wearing these over 12 hours if your foot gets sweaty.
customer_reviews.author: TheCalculator

customer_reviews.title: Good warm socks
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for warm socks that cost less than Smartwool socks. These are better and you get 3 for the proce of smartwool. I wear a womens size 9, bought S-M socks. They have gone thru the dryer several times and fit fine. Can't comment on the durability yet but it can't be worst than Smartwool (my previous fav).
customer_reviews.author: Kay C.

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I am called upon to stand outside for long periods at my work, and I was looking for a way to keep my feet warm in winter. These socks were the answer to my problem. They are warm, comfortable, and work as promised. I highly recommend these socks for anyone looking for warmth during the colder months. I plan to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Burgh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wool socks. Excellent price
customer_reviews.text: These wool socks are a great percentage of wool which is hard to find and you get a package for the price, not a single pair. That is wonderful. My husband loves these socks. He wears a size 11.5 or 12 and does wish they were a bit larger size but they do fit. But he would definitely order a larger size if they had one.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: A MUST BUY!
customer_reviews.text: My husband works for an exploration drilling company and is out in the elements for 12 hour shifts. Needless to say, his feet get smelly in the summer and cold and smelly in the winter. Since buying these his feet don't stink half as bad after work, they are comfy and he's completely addicted!! I've bought quite a few pair for him now, "Hunnie can you buy me more 'happy feet' socks please?" Has now become a thing in our house. I always correct him and tell him the brand is Alvada but he just says, "these socks make my feet happy so they are happy feet socks!" Haha. Great product, highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Christyn Giannini

customer_reviews.title: Good sock for cool/cold days
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these just to try them out, sort of to see if there was anything better out there (for a reasonable price) than the Smart Wool socks I usually get. I was pleasantly surprised at how much I liked these. They make for a very decent boot sock, thicker than the Smart Wool socks I get, fit well, very comfy, good cushion, and I've taken to wearing them around the house on chilly days. I'll still get the Smart Wools, but I'll also get more of these--I mean, some days you just need that "something more."
customer_reviews.author: Michael McGrady

customer_reviews.title: Thick and Very Warm Socks, Long Lasting
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely, hands down, best wool socks. Thick, very warm, soft against skin. I am a woman who wears size 6.5 boots and shoes and am only 5’1”, so petite. Socks reach calf. S-M worked well. One year of heavy use later, no tears but there is pilling. No bright colors but if you’re okay with grey or blue (workplace hues) then perfect.
customer_reviews.author: badDog4

customer_reviews.title: they breath well and are comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing these for about a month now and find them very comfortable as they breath nicely and can keep you feet warm or cool. They go on easily without having to muscle them on and feel good as soon as they cover your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Cpt Roland Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Not for small feet.
customer_reviews.text: I should have been wary of the 6 to 10.5 size range. That's a huge range! I am a size 7 and these were absolutely massive so there is no way that they would ever fit someone smaller than a size 9 or so. Don't buy if you have small feet.
customer_reviews.author: Kail Miller

customer_reviews.title: So glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Purchased again May of 2020; these are the only socks my husband wants to wear! He loves them all year round. Great for boots, which he wears daily. Bought for my husband who works outside all year long. They were supposed to be a stocking stuffer, but had to give them to him 3 weeks early because they just impressed me that much! So glad I did! They kept his feet warm in the 15 degree Connecticut winter weather today, and feel great.
customer_reviews.author: amay325

customer_reviews.title: So warm and comfortable while being breathable.
customer_reviews.text: Socks are amazing. Bought these for working out in the freezing weather. My feet always got cold which made me cold the entire shift. Bought these and that problem is gone. I love them because here in Texas the night shift may be cold and during the day it may warm up to 70 degrees. These socks are very warm and even on a warmer day, they will not make your feet sweat. I recommend them if you have feet like mine that seem to never get warm during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: best sock of my 57 years
customer_reviews.text: In the rocky mountains of Utah.Snow shoeing,back country skiing,hiking,and wood crafting overnighters in our mountains during winter.Finally in my 57 years i found an incredible sock that is warm and stays dry throughout the entire day and night of hiking in snow with temperatures around 0-10 degrees f. ,amazingly comfortable,hands down the most comfortable sock I have ever tried,and yes I am odering a couple more pair,in order to eventually be the only sock I have.Made with great quality,i cannot say enough good things about these Alvada 80% merino wool socks..oh ya they stay dry and cool in warmer weather also,did I say how comfortabl they are !!!
customer_reviews.author: Jay "bird"

customer_reviews.title: COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Walk dogs every morning and ordered these socks to keep my feet warm and dry. These are very good. Comfortable and I can wear them with my boots. Might be a little heavy for athletic shoes. My husband borrowed them one day and liked them too. They specify to wash and hang dry, which could be a nuisance, but they come out of the washer nearly dry and finish drying quickly. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: UPwoman

customer_reviews.title: Super thick
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks for a trip to Lapland next winter...I tried them on and they are very comfortable and thick! These will be great wearing them with my boots, temps could be in negative range there. I think I will buy a 2nd package of these. I imagine they will work well.
customer_reviews.author: ms r.

customer_reviews.title: BEST WOOL SOCKS I HAVE EVER PURCHASED! Get the NOW!
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST socks that we brought on our ski trip and outperformed the other brands that we paid TRIPLE for! My daughter’s feet were freezing to the point that she could not longer snowboard - we traded the very popular (and expensive) pair of socks she had on for these and she was good to go afterward!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vlashaune

customer_reviews.title: Excellent socks!!
customer_reviews.text: These socks are excellent for normal use. I walk at least a mile in them every day and they've held up after a dozen washes but they're still good to go if you don't mind minor pilling. If you're an avid hiker these won't fit the bill, but if you're just looking for something comfortable, warm, and cheap, then these are the best you can find at this price range. Also, they're excellent for lounging around the house in. Ultra cozy and warm. P.S. These are THICK wool socks. If your boots were tight before, they'll be even tighter now, so plan accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Thick, but not the warmest.
customer_reviews.text: These are not the type of socks you can lounge around your house in because they are "too thick" and your feat will get warm indoors that way. But when you are outdoors in the cold for a while, these songs aren't that warm after all. For as thick as they are you would think they are actually warmer then they are but they are not. Was outside today in low 40's all afternoon and feet got cold.
customer_reviews.author: COShopper

customer_reviews.title: Very soft and cushiony.
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be excellent - I say that because I just got them and beyond trying them on for fit, I haven't actually worn them yet. I wondered how they would fit because of the wide range of sizes, but somehow they fit without bunching inside either my boots or my hiking shoes. (For reference, I wear a women's size 8 shoe).
customer_reviews.author: Dolores Gitlin

customer_reviews.title: New York winter approved
customer_reviews.text: Went to new York for christmas time and I was already feeling super cold here in california (probably vitamin deficient) anyways I knew I had to invest in some warm clothes and socks were on top of my list so I bought these for myself and my husband and to make it short we both felt really comfortable wearing these and speed walking around the city. I do reccomend. They are bulkier than regular socks but I think thats common sense, the bulkier the warmer.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Beware of womens sizing
customer_reviews.text: Product says it will fit woman's size 6. I wear a woman's 6 1/2 and the small size socks were way too long for me. I gave them to my grandson who wears a man's size 9 and they fit his foot well.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn W.

customer_reviews.title: Great socks for the colder weather
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice socks overall. I ordered these for a trip up to the mountains to keep my feet warm and they did a great job. They are a little thicker then your standard sock but still had no issue in my hiking boots. I actually felt warmer overall which is what I wanted. Great quality socks overall and I plan on purchasing more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Robotica Industries

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable sock ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've been hooked on the smart wool socks for years. Now found these, and they are the best. They are thick enough to feel cushioned, but strangely don't make my shoes too tight. If you've never tried smart socks, start with these. If you to are hooked on smart socks, you'll love these. I just ordered more!
customer_reviews.author: Margo Green

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for the winter because I was tired of wearing 2 socks to keep my feet warm. Now I only wear a pair of these and my feet haven't been cold yet. I'm super happy with this purchase. They are comfortable and also great to lounge in. My only complaint (and its a small one) is that they wear a little bit in the wash but it is wool so I get it.
customer_reviews.author: AnonymousPrime

customer_reviews.title: Toasty warm.......
customer_reviews.text: OK...if you're looking for warm socks for the winter....look no further. I always knew wool socks kept you warm but so many of the so called "wool" socks are less than 20% wool. Those other socks will keep you warmer than regular socks but they often make them three times as thick to do the job. Not these socks....a little thicker than my normal socks but so much warmer! I put them on with a pair of Timberlands and my feet were toasty all day in 34 degree weather. The fit was perfect for my 9 1/2 feet. They feel well made and let my feet breathe when I took my boots off. Should have got these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Wentzler

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I'm a small woman and these are my favorite socks. They are cozy but breathable, great for lounging in, hiking in, or wearing with work boots. They offer plenty of cushion for a long days work, and I have also folded them down a smidge and worn them with "cute" boots. No one can tell they aren't "cute" boot socks. Very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Jarena

customer_reviews.title: Solid value
customer_reviews.text: Really love these socks! Normally I pay so much for socks like these, so I was thrilled to find them available at this price. They're pretty thick socks, and they tend to make your shoe size decrease by .5, so plan accordingly. Great for cold weather. Haven't gotten a blister yet. They insulate really nicely, but if you're running around in hot weather and closed toe shoes they can get a little toasty. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: lisa murray

customer_reviews.title: Warm but not to bulky
customer_reviews.text: Very warm. I'm a Floridian and bought these for my winter trip to Maine. These socks worked great. Kept my feet warm. They're not too bulky and felt comfortable in my winter boots. Seems like they're made really good and should last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: rj4wd

customer_reviews.title: Stinky stinky musty moldy eeewwwww.
customer_reviews.text: One star only cause these things showed up stinking SO bad of musty mold that they had to have been stored and soaked for a very long time either wet or incredibly moist and humid. Box was dry. Socks were dry. Musty odor about knocked me over opening the box. As far as quality...if I can wash out the odor they look be be good quality. But holy cow right outta the box do they STINK!
customer_reviews.author: Robert W

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I love these socks. They’re not scratchy. They’re comfortable. I wear them to bed, in boots, and just to lounge around the house in. After several washes, I haven’t noticed any wear or tear. I’ve had them for almost two months. I bought another three pack so that I didn’t have to keep washing the same three pairs over and over. I would also comfortably wear these in uniform boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but not durable at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband since he had worn through his other pairs and these seemed to have good reviews. At first, everything was great but it wasn't long, just a couple of months, before the socks started to get holes in the bottom. I wouldn't recommend these for anyone who spends an average amount of time on their feet during the day and we definitely won't be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hurd

customer_reviews.title: Not as amazing as you'd think.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I always have sweaty feet during the winter, which cools the sweat leading to me freezing all the time. I bought these socks because of all the praising reviews, of people writing that their feet stay dry. For my disappointment, this was not a magic solution. Although they are soft. nice and warm, my feet sweat after a few minutes. Sometimes they do the job fine, keeping them dry an warm, I think depending on the outside temp, but must of the times not so much. To your consideration
customer_reviews.author: Yoel

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality for One Third the Cost of Smart Wool
customer_reviews.text: I took a flyer on these socks because they were three for $20. I pay over $20 a pair for the heavy Smart Wool brand. These are a bit lighter in weight but, to me, are just as warm (they are 80% Merino) and fit a bit better. I've only been wearing them for three days so I can't address longevity but if they hold up they will be my go-to winter sock.
customer_reviews.author: shrinkucci

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered these socks because my feet are always cold and winter was coming. I’ve been wearing these socks for 6 months now and I love them! I wear them biking. Hiking. In my snow boots. I’ve washed my car and my canvas shoes have gotten wet but my socks stay dry. They wick moisture pretty good also. I have not had any wearing of the fabric problems. I love them! I’m going to order some other wool socks and compare them.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: GREAT OUTDOOR SOCKS
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome Merino Wool socks. Wash them inside out. They've been holding up and are my favorite socks when out in the bush doing bushy things. Even in the summer heat these bad boys are preferable to anything else inside of your boots. Lots of cushion on your soles and feels soft instead of "scratchy." Toasty warm in the winter and surprisingly cool and breathable in the summer compared to other materials like 100% cotton. Doesn't hold in the smell and sweat like synthetic socks do either. My wife even just likes having these on while lounging around the house. Will be ordering more down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I've recently worn these on a winter camping trip, and they were extremely comfortable, keeping my feet warm and dry through some pretty dismal weather. I wear a size 9 shoe, so I went with the S-M size, which was a good choice for me. At about $20 for three pairs, these are a great value. My all-time favorite wool socks are these Wigwam Merino Comfort Hikers (sorry, not sure how to include the nicely-formatted urls):  but the Wigwams are quite a bit more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory King

customer_reviews.title: As warm as socks twice the price.....  yet also twice as comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I used these socks on a cold Vermont winter weekend (negative degree temps) and they performed amazingly. My feet were always warm and comfortable. They appear very very durable. When you consider the price on top of this performance - total win! Buy them!
customer_reviews.author: John M. Krumenacker

product_meta.title: Alvada 80% Merino Wool Hiking Socks Thermal Warm Crew Winter Sock for Men & Women 3 Pairs
product_meta.description:
PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :5 x 5 x 0.7 inches; 2.08 Ounces
 * Department :Mens
 * Date First Available :June 28, 2018
 * Manufacturer :Alvada
 * ASIN :B07F3FFTMK

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #2,566 in Sports & Outdoors (See Top 100 in Sports & Outdoors)  *  #139 inMen's Outdoor Recreation Clothing 
    *  #4 inMen's Hiking Socks 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.6 out of 5 stars3,369 ratings
feature_bullets: 80% Merino wool, 15% polyester, 4% nylon and 1% spandex

MAKE HIKING A COMFORTABLE EXPERIENCE These Merino wool hiking socks are built to provide you with total support and comfort during your hiking trips, no matter the weather. Each pair of these hiking socks is ideal for the rugged terrain, allowing these to be great mens or women's hiking socks

ITCH FREE MATERIAL These wool hiking socks come blended with nylon to promote a comfortable, itch free experience. Ultra comfortable, these women and mens hiking socks won't cause you to pause in your step to scratch at your foot or readjust the calf height sock

KEEP YOUR FEET WARM DURING COLD WINTER HIKES With these hiking socks, women and men alike can enjoy the comfortable warmth that these cozy socks provide. Especially good for the colder months, each winter sock in the pair of men and womens wool socks will keep out the cold and moisture that wintertime often affords

SUPERIOR CUSHIONING IN THE FOOTBED These mens and womens hiking socks offer a shaped cushioning in their footbed to promise a more comfortable trek up the mountain. Through the use of these mens wool socks, women and men can enjoy less fatigue and pain in their feet after a long day of hiking in these ladies wool socks
SIMPLE TO CARE FOR When you get home, these wool socks mens accessories can be washed easily. Just put these women and mens hiking socks in the wash on cold and these wool socks will be good to go
